questions: A number of forces acting simultaneously on a body cause a change in its state of rest. Which of the following best describes these forces?
Which of the following statements best describes the situation in which a newspaper is lying at rest on your coffee table?
option1: The desk pushes on the paper only
option2: No forces are acting on the paper.
option3: The forces acting on the paper are balanced.
option4: The paper pushes on the desk only

questions: A moving ball rests after sometime even if no one or nothing stops it purposefully. What are the external forces which might play a role in this phenomenon?
option2: Change in shape of the ball

questions: Type of inertia that tends to resist the change in case of an “Athlete often runs before taking a long jump” is:

option1: Body will stay wherever it is

questions: Expression for Newton’s second law is Ft = m (v - u). What will happen if a body is at rest and F = 0?
option1: u = 0 and F = 0 ? v = 0 ? body will stay at rest
option2: v - u = 0 and u = 0 ? v = 0 ? body will stay at rest
option3: u = 0 and t = 0 ? v = 0 ? body with stay at rest
option4: v - u = 0 ? F = 0 ? there is no external force

questions: How does a wicketkeeper in cricket benefit from pulling his hands backward after catching the ball shot at the wickets?

option1: Object A has half the momentum of Object B
option2: Object A and Object B both have the same momentum
option3: Object A and Object B both have no momentum
option4: Object A has double the momentum of Object B

questions: What is the force acting on a Diwali rocket if it ejects 0.03 kg of gases per second at an acceleration of 200 m/s²?
Which of the following expressions proves that a body at rest will continue to be at rest if there is no external force?
option1: u = 0 and F = 0 ? v = 0 ? body will stay at rest
option2: v - u = 0 and u = 0 ? v = 0 ? body will stay at rest
option3: u = 0 and t = 0 ? v = 0 ? body with stay at rest
option4: v - u = 0 ? F = 0 ? there is no external force

questions: If equal forces are applied to an object A that has a mass of 95g and an object B with a mass of 22g, which object is going to accelerate the most?
option3: They will accelerate the same amount
